overview: From 2025-10-26 to 2025-11-02, elizaos-plugins/plugin-knowledge had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: Add static provider for listing available documents
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Create documentsProvider to show available RAG documents
- Display document metadata (filename, type, size, source)
- Static provider for context efficiency
- Helps agent understand which documents it can reference
- Avoids displaying base64 content, uses metadata instead


<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Adds a static `documentsProvider` that lists available knowledge documents, integrates it into plugin providers/exports, and bumps version to 1.5.13.
> 
> - **Providers**:
>   - Add `documentsProvider` (`src/documents-provider.ts`) to list available knowledge documents via `KnowledgeService.getMemories`, filtering by `MemoryType.DOCUMENT` and formatting summary output.
>   - Register in plugin (`src/index.ts`) by adding to `providers: [knowledgeProvider, documentsProvider]` and export it.
> - **Version**:
>   - Bump `package.json` version from `1.5.12` to `1.5.13`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 15d97c620a0e2d83d3138c5135198397605a8012. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topContributors.summary: standujar: This week, standujar drove significant feature development, most notably implementing a unified messaging API (`eliza#6095`) and adding critical multi-tenancy support with PostgreSQL Row-Level Security in `eliza#6101`, a complex change with over 2700 lines added. They also shipped several important bug fixes for server stability and agent persistence (`eliza#6105`, `eliza#6106`) and enhanced the Solana plugin with wallet improvements (`plugin-solana#21`). Their work shows a primary focus on new feature implementation, complemented by refactoring and bug fixes across the codebase.

wtfsayo: This week, wtfsayo focused on implementing a new Jobs API for one-off agent messaging in the `elizaos/eliza` repository, merging a significant feature PR (#6098) that added over 5,300 lines of code. They also updated dependencies in the `elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp` repository (#18) and have two additional PRs open to extend the new Jobs API. Their work was primarily concentrated on feature development, bugfixes, and refactoring across code, tests, and documentation.

odilitime: Made substantial progress on new features and refactors across multiple plugins, opening 6 pull requests with a significant volume of changes (+5981/-1855 lines). This work includes major enhancements like adding a Discord slash command interface (elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord#23) and refactoring the transaction system in the Solana plugin (elizaos-plugins/plugin-solana#24). Their efforts were concentrated on feature development and code improvements for the Anthropic, Discord, EVM, and Solana plugins.

0xbbjoker: Focused on expanding plugin capabilities this week, merging three PRs that delivered new features and a bug fix. They notably added text embedding model support in a significant PR for the OpenRouter plugin (plugin-openrouter#17) and implemented a static provider for listing documents in the knowledge plugin (plugin-knowledge#45). Their work, which also included two peer review approvals, was primarily centered on bug fixes and feature development, with a secondary focus on documentation.

ChristopherTrimboli: Focused on expanding command-line interface capabilities by implementing a new login command for elizaos. This significant feature was delivered in a single large pull request (elizaos/eliza#6100), which included over 1000 lines of new code and associated tests. In addition to this primary contribution, they also supported the team by reviewing and approving two other pull requests.

yungalgo: Focused on enhancing project documentation this week, merging two pull requests in `elizaos/docs`. Their most notable contribution was adding a community call-to-action (elizaos/docs#78) to drive user engagement, with work primarily touching documentation and configuration files.
tcm390: Made a targeted contribution to the elizaos/eliza repository this week, merging a pull request (elizaos/eliza#6104) to allow for custom options.

ai16x402: Focused on expanding the plugin registry this week, opening a pull request to add the new 'kolscan' Solana trading plugin (elizaos-plugins/registry#237). This work consisted of an update to a configuration file.
linear: Focused on project planning this week, creating two issues in elizaos/eliza to define a UI update for social links (#6089) and a new unified messaging API (#6096).

Vianvolaeus: This week, Vianvolaeus contributed by identifying a bug in the weekly summary display, opening issue elizaos/elizaos.github.io#168 to report that profiles were showing an incorrect week and date.
